summary: Senior Network Architect with 30+ years designing and operating enterprise healthcare and high‑availability networks. Currently leading network modernization at Ventura County Health Care Agency, migrating legacy infrastructure to Catalyst and Nexus platforms. Expertise in Software‑Defined Access and Identity Services Engine, with a strong focus on clinical workflow continuity, security, and compliance. CCIE certified since 1997 with recertification across multiple technology tracks.

experience.title: Senior Network Engineer
bullets: Lead network architect modernizing clinical and corporate infrastructure supporting thousands of endpoints across multiple clinic locations.

Architecting migration from legacy Cisco platforms to Catalyst and Nexus 9000 series across campus and data center environments, reducing hardware footprint by 30% while improving performance and manageability.
Designed Software-Defined Access fabric with Catalyst Center and ISE for network access control, implementing micro-segmentation to achieve HIPAA compliance.
Built network automation using Ansible and Python for hundreds of devices, reducing configuration errors by 80% and cutting deployment time from 3 days to 2 hours.
Perform packet-level analysis using Wireshark to troubleshoot complex latency and connectivity issues impacting urgent-care systems, maintaining service levels for 24x7 clinical operations.

experience.title: Principal Consultant
bullets: Provided network architecture and security consulting for enterprise and public-sector clients, designing high-availability solutions for compliance-driven healthcare and law enforcement environments.
Architected intrusion prevention and firewall solutions aligned with FBI CJIS and FIPS 140-2 requirements for law enforcement agencies handling sensitive criminal justice data.
Led threat mitigation and incident response programs, coordinating penetration testing and implementing security controls that reduced attack surface by 70%.
Designed distributed multi-site network topologies with MPLS and VPN technologies, producing integration plans for merger and acquisition activities.

experience.title: Network Architect
bullets: Designed resilient wide-area and enterprise wireless architectures supporting thousands of users, introducing software-defined networking concepts to increase operational flexibility.
Built automation frameworks with Ansible and Python to standardize configurations across network infrastructure, reducing manual errors and accelerating deployment cycles by 65%.
Collaborated with security teams to implement threat detection strategies, incident response plans, and data loss prevention measures aligned with SOX and PCI compliance.

experience.title: Executive Director, Network & Telecom
bullets: Directed network and telephony infrastructure strategy for enterprise supporting thousands of employees, managing multi-million dollar annual budget and multi-vendor project delivery.
Defined project milestones, service level agreements, and resource allocation to executive stakeholders, maintaining high network availability during organizational transformation.

experience.title: Associate Director, Voice & Data
bullets: Engineered and delivered six Tier 4 data center expansions supporting global production networks, implementing multi-vendor solutions within budget and timeline constraints.
Designed large-scale routing architectures and MPLS networks across multiple data centers for global telecommunications infrastructure.

experience.title: Senior Network Engineer
bullets: Designed and implemented global production networks across 12 countries supporting high-traffic web services, ensuring scalability and fault tolerance.
Led technology integration during major acquisitions, managing network consolidation and migration projects with minimal service disruption.

skills.items: Catalyst 9000, DNA/Catalyst Center, IOS-XE, SD-Access, ISE, TrustSec
OSPF, BGP, EIGRP, ISIS, MPLS, VXLAN/EVPN, Multicast, QoS, VRF
Network Access Control (ISE), 802.1X, MACsec, RADIUS/TACACS+, Firewalls, IDS/IPS, VPN
SolarWinds, Wireshark (packet-level), NetFlow, SNMP, Syslog, Vulnerability Testing
Ansible, Python, Terraform, Git, REST APIs, Infrastructure as Code
Azure, AWS, Cisco Wireless (9800 WLC, Wi-Fi 6/6E), Meraki

projects.title: cisco-mcp-server
projects.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Cisco network devices, enabling AI agents to interact with network infrastructure for automated discovery and management.
